name: Armatus Radiata
description:
--Fig06--
Armatus Radiata is an Amborellaceae Crustacean creature from Perwana, an exoplanet located 2010 light years away from Earth, orbiting the star Shama.
Armatus lives in groups of hundreds, which are called ‘Armatus Plantations’. Their central flowers are huge and can grow up to 4 meters in diameter. The flowers can only be reached by giant insects of Perwana, which can achieve an amazing 12 meters long if they consume Armatus ultra-nutritious pollen every week. Armatus is often referred to as ‘The Great Pollinator’.
Land animals from Perwana also want to consume and even eat the whole flower if they can, which will cause the death of Armatus, and that’s why it has 6 to 10 claws to protect the individual from land attacks.
